posts.body: Phew, this might be an OK temporary solution. Captchas must be possible to implement in a decentralized way.

Spammer is in this thread
[code]http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1565321266_1LT3fcyEShsU9E1H5wiBceWmEpU6LcK7v[/code]
If you want to say hi.

>>872571e7-0a2e-41eb-9468-e68d27663cc7
I too thought about this. But it's unfortunately really difficult to verify, poses the same issue of need for a central authority as captcha does.

>>8160a516-6615-4787-bd2b-0a4abd057c0f
Interesting proposition. Which authority would verify the users for the captcha whitelist? 
My thoughts would be network consensus, and a distributed database of ID's that users can query to generate the captchas. 
A possible weakness of this is certificate farming, we need some kind of limit to the lifetime of ID's. We also need the client to remember blacklists and board pins no matter the ID.
Fuck man nanochan is aids. It's just one Asuka avartarfag shitting up all boards

>>13a0b55e-fada-4ddc-ac39-c797f900a20d
Luckily the cryptoniggers have already developed much of the tools and tricks to make shit work

>>c7cfcec8-9051-4d29-8290-b692102421f9
How would this be any kind of gay op? That letter fits his humor to the letter, and also shows a love for travel. There is nothing in it that would suggest anything subversive. RIP his stamps though, guards probably got them now :'(

>>0224d160-a881-4f8f-8fca-b44a06ddc4d0
I would assume mild cabin fever from the isolation. Look at the long paragraph about Russia. He is obviously trying to uphold his inner strength whilst still being desperate to talk.

>>1bd77b5b-dd0b-48aa-b955-cbdbd50f7a7a
Tarrant is a smart guy. He would know to include a clue that the intended recipient could understand. Solving a puzzle is one thing, guessing it from nothing is an entirely different beast.

>>b9540a81-674a-487f-9f9c-2ab37e6790d2

>>356f3b4e-f517-48cb-856f-9138bcc8fdc4
